item.title: airtype project makes it possible to type without a keyboard
item.description: Airtype project is currently a prototype that makes it possible to type almost on anything without a keyboard by just wearing their devices on both hands. Airtype maps your finger movements to get the letters that you are typing, This means that you dont have to learn anything new. If you know typing that is all required to start using this product.

item.title: chance to win 10000 dollars if you are a hacker
item.description: Tesla Motors has announced at the SyScan Conference in Beijing that white hat hackers will have the chance to win $10000 if they can successfully hack into a Model S and manipulate the cars controls remotely

item.title: Mars one project to simulate red planet on earth
item.description: As we know that mars one mission has already picked future crew members for one way trip to the red planet, now they are planning to simulate red planet on earth to prepare them for their life on Mars.

item.title: Printing Sugar Candies and Chocolates for Real
item.description: Chefjet has demonstrated first food printing machine, which can actually print candies of different colors for real.

item.title: Hand of God captured by NASAs NuSTAR spacecraft
item.description: This stunning picture depicts a pulsar wind nebula, produced by the dense remnant of a star that exploded in a supernova.

item.title: Android OS in cars is the new trend?
item.description: Google's android OS is making its way to mate with Cars from Phone. Audi is making an imminent shift to Android from its Audi MMI Operating system to power its multimedia platforms.

item.title: Animal cells can touch and talk to one other
item.description: Scientist has discovered that animal cells can communicate with one another by making physical contact to one another. This mechanism is similar to the way neurons communicate with other cells.

item.title: Skype social media platforms hacked by Syrian Electronic Army
item.description: Skype's social media platforms have been hacked by a group claiming to be the Syrian Electronic Army(SEA).

item.title: India to have 155 million mobile internet users by March
item.description: The number of users accessing the web on their mobile phones in India is expected to reach 155 million by March 2014.

item.title: 1058 volunteers picked to Live and Die on Mars
item.description: Mars one has announced that it has picked 1058 volunteer spaceflyers to move on to the Red Planet to Live and Die as the First Humans on Mars.

item.title: India's first manned moon mission
item.description: India is getting set to follow the foot steps of Neil Armstrong through its first manned moon mission. The Indian Air Force has been given the responsibilities for this mission.

item.title: Technologies coming in 2014 Smart watches and Wearable Tvs
item.description: When it comes to technlogy 2013 was just a begining for something greater such as Smart Watches and Wearable. We can expect more to come in 2014 with advanced technologies than that of 2013.

item.title: egyptian-rock-art-dates-back-4000-years-bc
item.description: An ancient piece of spider rock art has been found in the Kharga Oasis in Egypt which dates back to 4000 B.C

item.title: how big is the universe?
item.description: As the technology has evolved, astronomers are able to look back in time to the moments just after Big Bang to study and find how big is the universe?

item.title: womens safety app guardian launched
item.description: Guardian is an ultimate security app developed to track and ensure the safety of your dear ones and especially women, after the tragic incident of nirbhaya.

item.title: weakest solar activity in a century
item.description: scientist from San Francisco says that sun's current space cycle is the most weakest activity in a century.

item.title: mac pro available starting tomorrow
item.description: Apple today announced the all new Mac Pro will be available to order starting Thursday, December 19. New Mac Pro features the latest Intel Xeon processors, dual work stations-class GPUs, PCIe-based flash storage and ultra fast ECC memory.

item.title: tsunami history records discovered in indonesia
item.description: An Indonesian cave of Sumatra is providing stunning record of Indian Ocean Tsunamis that took place thousands of years ago.

item.title: eyes will be the new passwords in future samsung smartphones
item.description: Samsung is reportedly lining up an iris verification system, QHD resolution and a new Tizen OS as main technologies in the future samsung smartphones.

item.title: dogs can even predict humans
item.description: Its amazing to know that dogs ability to understand humans is ever growing and they can even predict human behaviour.

item.title: meteor shower to light up sky tonight
item.description: Years most intense meteor shower is set to show up tonight (Friday) with almost 100 to 120 meteors per hour as NASA predicted.

item.title: stolen radio active source found in the field
item.description: The stolen radio active source has been found in the field says Mexico. The radio active cobalt-60 contained in the device has been removed from its protective shielding, but there is no indication that it has been damaged or broken up and no sign of contamination to the area.

item.title: dangerous radio active source stolen in mexico
item.description: United Nations agency says thieves stole extremely dangerous material from a truck outside Mexico City.

item.title: scientist create malware that communicates using sound
item.description: Scientists at Fraunhofer Institute for Communication have developed a malware that can communicate with other machines nearby, using standard speakers and microphones.

item.title: camera that takes 3D images in total darkness
item.description: Scientist have developed a camera that can take 3D images in almost total darkness using existing lasers and photon detecting technologies.

item.title: futuristic display made of atoms and not pixels
item.description: The tangible media group at MIT's Media Lab has unveiled a futuristic display made of atoms and not pixels.

item.title: amazon chat support gave this man the worst customer support
item.description: Do not use amazon chat support says Chris Williams when he experienced the worst customer support from a representive for Amazon.

item.title: amazon says drone deliveries are the future
item.description: Drone deliveries are the future says Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos, drones would be ready to take flight in four to five years.

item.title: clean solar energy supply from moon to earth
item.description: Luna ring is an upcoming Japanese technology which supplies unlimited solar power from moon to earth by laying solar panel belt on the moon's equator.

item.title: smartphone app to give earthquake warning
item.description: A smartphone app has been designed which gives early warning of earthquakes could be ready by next year, according to scientists at the world science forum in Rio de Janeiro.

item.title: fast and furious actor paul walker died in car crash
item.description: Paul walker, well known cop for fast driving in the movie fast and furious dies at the age 40 in a car crash and explosion says multiple sources. The accident happened in Santa Clarita -- north of Los Angeles -- and according to multiple sources connected to Paul ... the actor was in a Porsche when the driver somehow lost control and slammed into a post or a tree ... and then the car burst into flames.

item.title: soon android will be on computers
item.description: Intel is working on a version of android very hard so that you will be able use it instead of Windows in your corporate notebook. At an investor meeting last week, Intel was discussing to scale down Android to 64-bit so it could run on Intel's entire line of notebook processors, from the humble Atom all the way up to high-end Core processors.

item.title: earliest buddhism shrines discovered in nepal
item.description: Archaeologists in nepal have discovered the earliest known buddhist shrine that puts concrete date and location on the life of the man who founded Buddhism. For the first time buddhist have scientific evidence leading to the establishment of one of the major Buddhist shrines found at Lumbini in Nepal dating back to the 6th century B.C.

item.title: worlds first green helicopter
item.description: Volocopter is a revolution in aviation made in Germany by the company E-volo. It is simpler, safer and cleaner than normal helicopters. The Volocopter is environment friendly and emission-free private helicopter. Instead of one combustion engine, eighteen electrically driven rotors propel it.

item.title: An island nation in the pacific ocean is about to drown by climate change
item.description: Soon an entire country will be wiped of the map because of rise in sea level caused by global warming. Kiribati is the island in the pacific ocean, that will start to disappear around 2030 according to an article at bloomberg business.

item.title: women videotapes the news for 35 years non-stop
item.description: Marion strokes is the lady who made this legacy by recording the news begining from 1977 to 2012 has an incredible 140,000 tapes of local, national and cable news. She had to feed 6hr tape, 4times a day into the video recorder for about 35 years.

item.title: oldest big cat fossil found in tibet
item.description: The oldest big cat fossils have been unearthed in Himalayas, these unknown species are similar to snow leopard, lived 4.1 to 5.95 million years ago and has been named Panthera. This discovery in Tibet supports the theory that big cats evolved in Central Asia and not Africa.

item.title: comet ison heading for close encounter with sun
item.description: A comet named ISON is heading towards sun for a close encounter, the comet is supposed to vapourize at that temperature but the chances are that it won't... says the researchers.

item.title: satellite will fall to earth, but no one is sure where
item.description: A European satellite will be pulled down by the gravity to its fiery destruction in the next few days. The strange thing is that no one knows where it will crash, it could be almost anywhere on earth.

item.title: NASA obtained crucial data from meteoroid Impact
item.description: A team of NASA and international researchers have obtained crucial data from Meteoroid Impact that took place on Feb 15 2013 over a Russian city.

item.title: supernova to be seen from earth by 2063
item.description: Astronomers have calculated that in the next 50 years, a supernova is occurring in our home galaxy that can be visible from earth and the chances are 100%. It will be visible from telescopes in the form of infrared radiation. The chances are 20% or less so that this event can be visible or identified through naked eye as shining stellar spectacle in the night sky.

item.title: china shows of moon rover model
item.description: When everyone is busy with mars mission, China is preparing itself to send a Moon rover that will explore moon's surface in an upcoming mission. China has offered a rare glimpse of its rover from secretive space programme on tuesday.

item.title: hypersonic robot spy plane
item.description: U.S plans to reveal Hypersonic Robot Spy Planes by the end of 2030. These planes will be the successor of Supersonic Blackbird SR-71 spy plane. This unmanned SR-72 will use an engine that combines a turbine and a ramjet to reach its top speed of Mach 6 - about 5,800km/h.

item.title: platypus godzilla fossil unearthed in australia
item.description: Part of giant platypus fossil has been unearthed in Queensland, Australia. Scientist have dubbed it as Platypus-zilla because of its huge size which is more than 1 meter in length. The researchers also said that the creature lived between five and 15 million years ago.

item.title: internet is not going to save the world says the microsoft co-founder
item.description: These days we can see that west coast billionaires Facebook and Google are much interested in making internet available to billions of people around the world, where as the Microsoft co-founder says the basic things like child survival, child nutrition or malarial vaccine are much important than internet.

item.title: soon your movements will help you charge your cell phone
item.description: The mobile generator company Genneo has made a revolutionary change in the field of electronics by developing a new device that turns your motion into power for electronic devices such as mobiles, cameras, tablets and other USB charged electronics.

item.title: rare solar eclipse in America, Europe and Africa
item.description: A rare solar eclipse that is said to be the "Hybrid" of annular and total eclipse is visible in some parts of America, Europe and Africa. Experts warn that nobody should attempt to view the sun with the naked eye.

item.title: indian scientist reveals how life began on earth
item.description: Indian-origin palentologist, Dr. Sankar Chatterjee arrives to a conclusion that Icy comets which colloided earth over 3.8 billion years ago melted to combine with the organic compounds deposited by meteorites on earth which led to the formation of molecules and eventually life.

item.title: western digital warns mavericks users the risk of data loss
item.description: If you are a user of the new OSX Mavericks or planning for an upgrade to Mavericks, you need to be careful before you run into the problems of data loss with external hard drive from Western Digital. That’s right! Western digital's Drive Manager, Raid Manager or Smart-Ware applications are not compatible with Mavericks which might lead to data loss of your external hard drive.

item.title: exploration of mars to be launched
item.description: For those who were hoping a lot more in mars other than rocks and methane, NASA has announced to launch its MAVEN(Mars Atmospheric and Volatile EvolutioN) probe to Mars this month to find out why red planet lost much of its atmosphere. Long ago, Mars once had denser atmosphere that supported liquid water on the surface.
